title: The Dude for president and the amazing 'Jarvis Cocker kid' - today's pop culture as it happened | Culture | The Guardian
summary: is this michael cera 's diy bedroom pop album ?
while you were sleeping - links from america .

documents.title: all reich on the night : the evening 's entertainment options
text: before we send another guide daily into the box , here 's the night 's telly , which includes pranks , pensioners and pastries .
away from the tv , there 's a world of culture to explore , most notably prom 37 - a celebration of all things steve reich : reich on !

documents.title: is this michael cera 's diy bedroom pop album ?
text: < a href= '' that by michael cera < /a > entirely without fanfare , this charming little album of lo-fi folk-pop appeared on bandcamp last week .
the artist ?
michael cera apparently .

while there 's been no official confirmation , it would make sense for this to be the work of the man : there 's the dry little bio - michael cera was born in canada in 1988 at the tender age of zero - for one .
and true that 's scratchy diy sound , psych leanings and sunny melodicism seem in keeping with his musical tastes , which include the microphones , oz mutantes and weezer .

and if it 's not cera , well it 's just another good lo-fi album in a strong year for them , up there with the likes of alex g and bluffing : < a href= '' by alex g < /a > < a href= '' coated pills of wisdom by bluffing < /a >

documents.title: fire alarm over !
text: phew !
that was tense .
terrifying even .
much like [ clumsy segue ] this teaser trailer for the new silent hills game , which features the voice of the walking dead 's norman reedus :
attention : the guide daily is temporarily suspended due to a fire alarm at guardian hq normal service might resume later

documents.title: farewell to utopia ( for now ? )
text: mild spoilers ahead for anyone who has n't watched utopia series two in its entirety .

last night saw series two of utopia climax in a grand and bloody flourish , though with an ending ambiguous enough to suggest that , despite some underwhelming ratings , a third series is on its way .
here 's richard vine 's recap of episode six .

meanwhile , for those already getting deels-style withdrawal symptoms , den of geek have shared a couple of deleted scenes , both of which do a nice job of fleshing out the story of shifty , sweaty politician geoff , whose screen time was disappointingly brief this time around :

documents.title: lunchtime links
text: hi , gwilym here , readying myself for a manic afternoon of blogging .
before that though , it 's lunchtime !
here are a few cultural amuse-bouches to accompany your cucumber sandwiches : a conversation with fantasy 's eminence grise ( lots of french in this post , eh ? )
george rr martin , filmed live at the edinburgh festival .
a staggeringly long piece on why 37 is the funniest number , from comic eddie brawley .
preternaturals , the new album from kaleidoscopic psych two-piece grumbling fur , who for my money have more than a hint of skylarking-era xtc about them :

documents.title: jabberwocky fallout
text: neutral milk hotel : anti show stoppers pr image a few of us on the guide were looking forward to atp 's jabberwocky .
they 'd managed to assemble most of the best young bands around ( speedy ortiz , hookworms , metz , et al ) and their usual mix of more established outsiders ( neutral milk hotel , the ex ) .
but it was n't to be and they pulled the plug due to financial issues - did they really think people wanted to mission out to the excel centre ?

here 's a bit of their statement : we have put everything into promoting jabberwocky , and despite healthy ticket sales ; all our efforts could not take those sales to the point that we needed to finally stage the event .

over the past month and all the way up until this moment we have tried every possible course of action to follow through in delivering jabberwocky to you , but the position we unfortunately find ourselves in as a result of a succession of events that have lost money in an increasingly aggressive festival market , means we are no longer able to do so .
but what are all the bands , many of whom have other shows off the back of jw going to do now it 's gone tits up ?
well , many of them are arranging their own gigs and there 's even a site dedicated to rumours , confirmations and ticket links .

here are some of the best options for those looking to catch something this weekend : neutral milk hotel and the ex : the forum ben frost , forest swords : corsica studios pissed jeans , earth : birthdays kurt kile and the violators , nils frahm : village underground cloud nothings , hookworms and speedy ortiz : the 100 club the last one looks like a belter .

documents.title: music time !
text: the last 48 hours saw a deluge of interesting tracks plopped into the internet ether .

here 's a selection : the muppets cover the beastie boys kaytranada is having a moment kindness is back ( and sounding great ) joey bada $ $ gets mad in a dark room oh , and andrew wk and glenn beck bonded

documents.title: while you were sleeping - links from america
text: here 's a wee round-up of what 's been going on in the good ol ' usa overnight : lauren bacall died sad news as the silver screen star died yesterday .
we 've got a load of coverage including her life in clips .
here 's one of our favourites , from her cameo in the sopranos .

jimmy fallon did a house of cards spoof conan remembers robin williams : the best talk show host in the world dj shadow released some new music jeff bridges was encouraged to run for political office in montana the dude for senator ?

documents.title: meet the incredible jarvis kid
text: high up on a roof top in new york there was a pulp karaoke contest after a screening of the music doc pulp : a film about life , death & supermarkets .
jarvis was on hand to vote and so was the director florian habicht .
up stepped a nine-year-old kid and performed what i can only describe as a 'magical turn ' .
it 's a bit like that kid at summer camp who 'd be amazing at michael jackson moves , except this is jarvis cocker - which is kind of ironic really .

bulletin.text: You came and took a jaunt with us in our cultural low-rider.
We, in return, gave you trailers, a bit of music and the usual cultural detritus - and a fire alarm!
